Points.Title: Life Long Commitment
Points.Summary: Lifelong commitment begins with a decision that divorce is not an option and a determination to invest in your marriage every day.

Points.Title: Spending Enjoyable Time Together
Points.Summary: In the busyness of life, remember that love isn’t self-sufficient. Your marriage must be constantly fed and nurtured by spending regular time together.

Points.Title: Positive Communication
Points.Summary: Communication gives life to marriage when you spend time getting to know your spouse and allowing yourself to be deeply known by him or her.

Points.Title: Shared Spiritual Intimacy
Points.Summary: Couples who have a deep, shared faith and have Christ at the center of their marriage have a more satisfying relationship and deeper intimacy.

Points.Title: Healthy Individuals
Points.Summary: A healthy marriage is made of two healthy people. Commit to a lifetime of spiritual, emotional, physical and mental growth and development.

Points.Title: Mutually Satisfying Physical Intimacy
Points.Summary: Sex is God’s gift to a married couple as a way to experience the deepest, most profound intimacy possible—the two becoming one flesh.

Points.Title: Healthy Conflict Management
Points.Summary: Conflict is an inevitable part of marriage, but handled well, healthy conflict can become an opportunity for deeper intimacy and connection.

Points.Title: Shared Responsibility (Teamwork)
Points.Summary: Marriage means you are always on the same team. Make decisions and divide household responsibilities in a way that honors both of you.

Points.Title: Coping With Change, Stress and Crises
Points.Summary: You will face challenges on your journey together. Always fight for your marriage and trust that God will turn your pain to blessing.

Points.Title: Cherish
Points.Summary: Created by God, your fiancé(e) is of infinite worth and value. Reflect often on the things that you love and cherish about your future spouse.

Points.Title: Nourish
Points.Summary: Love involves action and behavior. You need to nourish your relationship with your fiancé(e) in ways that speak love to him or her.

Points.Title: Community-Mindedness
Points.Summary: Connecting regularly with like-minded couples who are committed to the good of your relationship is vital to the success of your marriage.
